definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: The pity of it is that an intelligent man appears to have been seduced by the sound of his own voice.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，這位智者似乎被自己的聲音誤導了。

sentences.english: Xylitol also appears to have potential as a treatment for osteoporosis.
sentences.chinese: 木糖醇似乎有治癒骨質疏鬆的潛力。

sentences.english: However, satisfaction also appears to be influenced by psychologic factors.
sentences.chinese: 然而，滿意程度似乎也是整個身體的影響因素之一。

sentences.english: There's something about being extroverted that seems to protect people.
sentences.chinese: 性格外向的人有某種東西似乎在保護他們。

sentences.english: It seems unfair. Except at the margins, there isn't much we can do about physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 似乎老天不太公平，我們不太能改變自己的長相。

sentences.english: People seem to sense who is powerful.
sentences.chinese: 人們似乎憑感覺就知道誰擁有權力。

sentences.english: Although it is not expensive, we never seem to have quite enough money.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這是不昂貴的，我們從來沒有，似乎已很夠了錢。

sentences.english: But the mood in Copenhagen yesterday did not seem conducive to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 但昨日哥本哈根的氣氛似乎不利於各方達成妥協。

sentences.english: Enlightenment, it seems, always comes from an earnest study of the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 啓迪似乎總是從懇切地研究上帝的道而來。

sentences.english: Your orgasms may not seem like the idealized one described here.
sentences.chinese: 你的高潮可能似乎不像這裏的理想描述。

sentences.english: It seemed as if they derived some sort of twisted pleasure from this brotherly fighting.
sentences.chinese: 這種兄弟相殘似乎使他們獲得了某種扭曲的快感。

sentences.english: But he seemed to only include ten letters in his list.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎只把十封信列入了他的清單裏。

sentences.english: No one in the bar appears surprised to see a disabled person dancing.
sentences.chinese: 看到希福跳舞，酒吧裏的人似乎一點都不喫驚。

sentences.english: In this age of the keyboard , some people seem to think handwriting lessons are on the way out.
sentences.chinese: 在這個鍵盤的年代，有人似乎認爲書法課即將滅亡。

sentences.english: Sneaking out may seem like a real option in the heat of anger.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，偷偷溜出去看上去似乎是真正的解決之道。

definition: to appear to be/to seem as if
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
